body.p:
Greenville Ky
Novr 18th 1863
To His Excelency
Gov Bramlett

Whereas a Judgement was rendered against Thomas P Boggess in favor of the The Commonwealth of Kentucky ^at Novr term 1863^ The fact are about these at the Novr term 18621 Boggess was recognized as a witness for the Defendants on an indictment against J W & M L Simpson charged with aiding in the escapes of a prisoner from Jail Boggess was at no time ever recognized on behalf of the Commonwealth at the May Term 1863 the action of the Commonwlth vs Simpson was continued and on the recognizance of Boggess was forfeited on motion of the Attorney for the Commonwealth at this time Boggess was in the hands of the Military authorities under arrest. So soon as the summons on the forfeited recognizance issued on was served Boggess spoke to one of the counsel for Deft Simpson to know why the forfeiture was taken when the counsel replied that it must be through mistake and he would have the matter corrected, upon these facts Boggess did not attend for the purpose of
of making defense and Judgment entered. After this a motion for new trial or to set aside the Judgment was made but overuled. We therefor request your excelency to remit said Judgement.

The facts in the foregoing petition, I can say are ^true^ of my own person knowledge. So far as they refer to matters of record, but what he was advised by one of the counsel for the Deft I can only speak from the affidavits filed for new trial from those facts I think his cause meritorious and calls for Executive clemency
I cheerfully join in the petition of Thomas P Boggess for the remission of the Judgement refered to above.

F. M. Bristow
R. T. Petree Cir. Judge
Jesse N Reno Clk M.C.Ct
Thos. J. Jones Clk Co Ct.
Jas P McIntire S M C
C. Eaves
B E Pullman
Jno E Reno
E. W. Martin
M. D. Hay
W B Harrison
Alvey McClean
T. E. Mann

Muhlenburg Cir Ct
vs
Remit forfeiture except costs & fees
Tho E Bramlette
Govr

Thos P. Boggess
3d Dec 1863
